thread.title: New Fresh Bowls in downtown Baton Rouge offers healthy options, including build-your-own salads, wraps
thread.title_full: New Fresh Bowls in downtown Baton Rouge offers healthy options, including build-your-own salads, wraps

title: New Fresh Bowls in downtown Baton Rouge offers healthy options, including build-your-own salads, wraps
text:
New Fresh Bowls in downtown Baton Rouge offers healthy options, including build-your-own salads, wraps New Fresh Bowls in downtown Baton Rouge offers healthy options, including build-your-own salads, wraps Photo by Matt Sigur -- Fresh Bowls, a downtown restaurant offering breakfast and lunch, opened last Friday. BY MATTHEW SIGUR | 
. 
Downtown residents and employees now have a healthy option. 
Fresh Bowls opened its doors last Friday. The new restaurant offers breakfast and lunch as well as daily specials. Fresh Bowls is located at 340 Florida Blvd. and is open 7 a.m.-3 p.m. Monday-Friday. 
Andrew Kennedy and Zack West are the owners of the new business, which is located in the former Lobby Caf√© space. 
For breakfast, Fresh Bowls offers build-your-own biscuits or wraps as well as grit cakes, breakfast bowls, and cinnamon roll and waffle bites. Breakfast options range from $3-$7. 
For lunch, patrons can have build-your-own salad bowls with up to four toppings for $6.25 (medium) or $8.25 (large). The restaurant also offers wraps and potatoes for lunch. 
Follow Matthew Sigur on Twitter @MatthewSigur . Get The Advocate in your inbox
